content: @Eric Wieser Because #30913 was made as a PR into a non-master branch that was subsequently merged and deleted, Bors closed this PR before it was reviewed.
Fixed! @Bryan Gin-ge Chen, do you have a feel for whether we can easily teach bors not to do this?

We can turn off the auto-deletion of branches by bors by changing the delete_merged_branches option

This option only affects PRs that are not from forks, and we have very few of those left, so I don't mind changing it.
I don't feel strongly either way about it, but here's #31110 flipping the bit.
What would be good behaviour for a pr into a branch that was merged?

I think when @Eric Wieser reopened this it was still as a PR between branches and again was just closed by @Yaël Dillies w/o being merged. Can someone change the target branch or is it easier to open a new PR? Thanks!
Whoops, sorry, I didn't mean to close this!
